mdRecord.dcterms:title: Midland Bank Head Office, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lutyens, Edwin (English architect, 1869-1944) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In the year 1891, Midland acquired the Central Bank of London and by 1898 it had relocated its main headquarters to the city. The later building constructed by Lutyens was to house the bank headquarters after it had expanded its customer base and stretched its market across the globe, growing, as an organization, exponentially in the process. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
